meanings.definition: Assign a date earlier than the actual date.
meanings.sent1: She backdates the letter to make it seem like it was sent earlier.
meanings.sent2: The clerk backdates the document to show it was completed on time.
meanings.sent3: He backdates his diary entries to pretend he has a better memory.
meanings.sent4: The artist backdates his signature on the painting for a vintage effect.
meanings.sent5: Backdating the contract can sometimes lead to legal issues.

meanings.definition: To date something with a date that is earlier than the current date.
meanings.sent1: They backdates the receipt to show an earlier purchase date.
meanings.sent2: The professor backdates the assignment to accommodate a late submission.
meanings.sent3: Backdating the invitation made it seem like a time-travel themed party.
meanings.sent4: The detective backdates the evidence to solve the cold case.
meanings.sent5: Backdating the journal entry gave a false impression of productivity.
